2023 Interim Inspection Report
Dear Tajuanda Carey:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
09/19/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed or
implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Linda Tansil, area manager, at 248-860-0787.
Sincerely,
Vivian D Malleck, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
(1) An institution shall maintain employee records for
each employee and shall include documentation of all
of the following information prior to employment or at
the time specified in this rule:
(e) Three dated references which are obtained prior
to employment from persons unrelated to the employee
and which are less than 12 months old.
One of four new employee files reviewed did not have three letters of reference.
Chief administrator recalled reviewing three references letters for this staff person,
2

but the reference letters are not uploaded in Spectrum Human Services new
electronic personnel file system.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• None at this time.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Recommended removing wire hangers from youth closets for safety reasons.
• Discussed treatment report timelines based on contractual obligations. Beverly
House completed first updated treatment report for each youth 30 days earlier
than required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with CAP is as follows:
Beverly House is in compliance with their 07/21/2022 renewal inspection corrective
action plan regarding youth immunizations. Intake coordinator obtains immunization
records from the referring agency and verifies immunizations are current. Case
manager schedules needed immunizations within 30 days of youth placement.
Financial Overview
Beverly House is operated under Spectrum Human Services. Spectrum Human
Service Inc. is a 501(c)3. Their financial audit was reviewed and found fiscally
sound.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not applicable.
3

Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator Assessment was received and revied on 09/19/2023.
Assessment states there were not any barriers or systemic factors impacting rule
compliance. Assessment noted two of the six discharged youths during this
inspection period were unplanned due to the youth’s truancy. Beverly House staff
continue to focus on relationship building with youths to prevent truancy.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff was interviewed on 09/19/2023. Staff were able to explain policy and
procedures, for example, room check monitoring procedure. Staff did not express
concerns or training needs.
Three youths were interviewed on 09/19/2023. Youths explained Beverly House
program and did not express concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
Beverly House common areas were neat and orderly. Youth bedrooms and
bathrooms were tidy. Outside yard space was clean and usable for cookouts and
activities.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
